Dialog.Topics: The government's mid term review: deficit reduction

Turn.Utterance: (1) The damage done to the economy by the fiscal adjustment in reducing the structural deficit by 1% can hardly be "too fast". Surely the overwhelming and more note-worthy amount of damage done to the economy has been caused by cutting the deficit by "25%" by eliminating capital investment. (2) I think that comparing the structural deficit forecast by Mr Brown and Mr Darling with that caused by Cambourne & Clegg without further explanation is also dubious. Labour's efforts to continue the recovery would have resulted in a stark difference in the make-up of the structural deficit as a result of growth, when contrasted with C&C's unhappy tinkering with benefits which nevertheless continue to increase overall as a result of a policy of growth-adverse stagnation.
